info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:49AM EDT until April 5 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Eagle Creek at Zionsville.
.Recent multiple rounds of heavy rainfall is expected to lead to brief minor flooding on Eagle Creek at Zionsville early this morning. Water is forecast to recede later this morning into early next week.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Eagle Creek at Zionsville.
* WHEN...Until late this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Turkey Foot Road north of Temple Avenue and Holliday Road begins to flood. Low areas of Lions Park and Creekside Nature Park are flooded. Possible flooding of portions of Zionsville Golf Course.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 9.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 330 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON
